column4: not sure, I installed k3b on xfce but couldn't tell you how much extra space it used
mark it in Synaptic and see what it wants to include and how much additional space it wants to use, can cancel if its too much
I'm just thinking about other users which are mislead into thinking that just because one app is "for KDE" (uses QT), that is not a reason no to install it in your gnome desktop, and vice versa
got ya, I run xfce and I use a few gtk apps and a few qt apps, avidemux being one that looks better in qt then gtk
